programme.desc: Damian Lillard hits a walk-off 3-pointer to send Portland along in the playoffs. Lillard finishes with a franchise playoff-record 50 points and Portland eliminates OKC from the postseason in 5 games with a 118-115 victory. From April 23, 2019.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.sub-title: 2019: Denver Nuggets at Portland Trail Blazers
programme.desc: Second Round, Game 3. From May 3, 2019.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.sub-title: 2019: Portland Trail Blazers at Denver Nuggets
programme.desc: CJ McCollum scores 37 points and adds a crucial chase-down block in the closing minutes that help the Blazers beat the Nuggets in Game 7 to advance to their first conference championship since 2000.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.sub-title: 2019: Golden State Warriors at Houston Rockets
programme.desc: James Harden makes a big 3-pointer in overtime and scores 41 points, and the Houston Rockets outlast the Golden State Warriors 126-121 to cut the deficit in the Western Conference semifinals to 2-1. From May 4, 2019.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.sub-title: 2019: Golden State Warriors at Houston Rockets
programme.desc: Second Round, Game 6. From May 10, 2019.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: Los Angeles Lakers at Portland Trail Blazers

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: West 153, East 132, Kobe Bryant MVP. This is Bryant's second MVP title (Philadelphia 2002). From Feb. 18, 2007, in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics

programme.title: WNBA Basketball

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.sub-title: 2025 NBA Finals: Oklahoma City Thunder at Indiana Pacers
programme.desc: Bennedict Mathurin scored 27 points off the bench, Tyrese Haliburton finished with 22 points, 11 assists and nine rebounds, and the Pacers retook the lead in the NBA Finals by beating the Oklahoma City Thunder 116-107 in Game 3.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.sub-title: 2025 NBA Finals: Oklahoma City Thunder at Indiana Pacers
programme.desc: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander delivered, scoring 15 of his 35 points in the final 4:38, capping Oklahoma City's rally from a 10-point, second-half deficit and sealing a 111-104 win over the Indiana Pacers 111-104 to tie the NBA Finals at two games apiece.
